home-content.content-1: My name is Kevin Brinach I'm 27 years old. Over the past three years I've been working as a freelance web developer -frontend mostly- building websites with frameworks based on JavaScript, like React.JS and Vue.JS. And of course I also use CSS, HTML5 and other technologies that you can see in the aforementioned section.
home-content.content-2: My hobbies range from sports to videogames and series. When I'm not programming I'm always doing something. Boredom doesn't exist for me.
home-content.content-3: I'm very passionate about programming and learning about said subject and I usually don't stop programming 'till the job is done.
home-content.content-4: If you have a project I can help with, please get in touch.

technologies-content.tech-header: Listed below are the technologies I usually use and my expertise on them

tooltips.vue: I develop most of my work using Vue.js
tooltips.react: I started making web apps in React
tooltips.html5: All my work relies on HTML5
tooltips.js: JavaScript was one of the first languages I learned
tooltips.vuetify: I usually use Vuetify for its sweet Material Design components
tooltips.bootstrap: Bootstrap is the first CSS framework that I used
tooltips.css: I don't rely only on CSS frameworks
tooltips.quasar: Quasar makes my life so much easier
tooltips.redux: I use Redux for its single state
tooltips.vuex: I use Vuex for its single state
tooltips.firebase: I've used Firebase and Firestore in some projects
tooltips.docker: I'm in the process of getting used to Docker
tooltips.node: I developed a REST API using Node.js along Express.js
tooltips.mongo: At college my peers and I used MongoDB to manage NoSQL databases
tooltips.github: I have my public repositories in GitHub
tooltips.trello: I organize my tasks in a project using Trello
tooltips.jira: I organize my tasks in a project using Jira
tooltips.sql: Management of relational databases at college

projects-content.header: These are some of the projects that I worked on:
projects-content.name: Project Name:

description.youpoach: Front-end for hiring platform for professionals and freelancers.
description.outilmaco: Front-end for fleet management system and remote monitoring for cargo trucks.
description.amano: Front-end for a company that provides products, designs and architectural services plus integration with their API.
description.cloudprop: Support for a proptech startup: rental management automation.
description.cobrawi: Support for massive payments notification platform.
description.colekine: Front and backend for integral management and billing system of a professional asociation.
description.freelo: Frontend for a company which has as a goal the automatization of the tax returns in Argentina.
description.planoo: Frontend for an Australian startup which aims to make the real state market in Canberra simpler for the ones looking for a new place to live in. This included an integration to the app's backend developed in .NET Core and to several Google Maps API.
